intro: Seseli vandasii, commonly known as the Vandasii Seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Seseli vandasii is often found in rocky or dry habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight.
